title: Bad block #1422330 gas used error (2278520 / 2278360).
body:
Reopening #1117 as requested in new ticket.
#### System information

Geth version: `geth 1.4.18`
OS & Version: Linux
#### Expected behaviour

Sync as desired.
#### Actual behaviour

```
E1016 10:13:25.094169 core/blockchain.go:1170] Bad block #2446183 (0x7a7499dd032df75ab05b942f1b460caa4282121decb2c1e6816668a395ca5b14)
E1016 10:13:25.094222 core/blockchain.go:1171] gas used error (487080 / 486440)
```
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Sync a geth node which was not fully synced before #3111 was merged.
#### Backtrace

copied from #1117 :

> Geth version is 1.14.18. Blockchain resync started with new release yesterday.

Can reproduce this issue. @karalabe is it possible this was introduced with the EIP 150 fork pull request?

There is @ropod7 also having this issue and at least one more guy on gitter right now.
How was this chain synced? Fast or regular? Did you run `develop` at any given time?
Since your database already appears to be broken already, could you run the following command in the console (`geth console`): `debug.setHead("1422320")` and then restart.

1. Synced fast.
   - Probably this fault shown even run --jitvm mode
2. Never ran "develop" at any time.
   Also I see that the fast synced database resets and starts syncing from 0 block after headers fully loaded. e.g. today.

Same error for me, but I'm on the testnet.
Running via Docker: 

```
image: ethereum/client-go:alpine
command: "--fast --testnet --shh --ipcpath /root/geth-ipc/geth.ipc"
restart: always
```

Log:

```
E1021 07:20:21.661136 core/blockchain.go:1170] Bad block #1790252 (0x5b6a3b73339b74b9fd71f24e0666e6734d575a38742507c564fb6ef7c67b1f56)
E1021 07:20:21.661188 core/blockchain.go:1171]     gas used error (2358052 / 2359852)
```

The testnet gas usage error seems to be caused my some miners pushing the non forked chain and a ton of old non upgraded nodes propagating the blocks. This causes fast sync to sync to the non forked chain, then obviously fail doing anything as the gas rices are bad. We haven't implemented the same fork protections we did for the DAO as noone figured someone would push the old chain; but we haven't considered the testnet's tiny difficulty which allows pushing the old chain.

I'll look into adding an enforced hash for the fork block so fast syncing the testnet cannot diverge on a malicious chain.

---

Regarding mainnet, we haven't found the cause of this issue yet.

I'm seeing `gas used error (129452 / 131252)` when trying to deploy a contract from truffle to testnet. 
It never happened with earlier Geths. 

Current Geth version: geth 1.4.18
OS & Version: Linux

Hope it helps))
@porobov can you share the contract / truffle invocation?
Are you correctly synced to the testnet?

How could i resolve?

Hey. It was an unfortunate last minute bug (one config field was updated with the wrong value for the testnet). The develop branch was already fixed to avoid this, so running that is one alternative (develop is currently exactly the same as the stable branch, just has this tiny fix). Otherwise we're releasing a minor update to the stable release hopefully today that will have this included.
